result.execSummary:
The defendant Dylan J. Moen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Conditions: 

90 days conditional jail time.

Pay costs of action and costs of probation including DNA. 

Defendant is to pay restitution in amt of $500 to victim JR. 

Attend, pay for and successfully complete any treatment/assessments as ordered by agent. 

Def is eligible for expungement under 973.015 upon successful completion of probation. Def is to follow up with the Clerk of Court regarding the expungement procedure when the time comes.

Parties stipulate to 9 days credit in the event of revocation.

* JOC AMENDED 1-12-16:  HUBER GRANTED.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Associated with Charge #1

Three cases called together (15CF84, 15CF91 & 15CF66). Defendant Dylan J. Moen in court with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Parties have reached resolution (15CF84 & 15CF91 are DRI as is count 2 in 15CF66. Ct 1 in 15CF66-sentence withheld for 3 yrs probation. Conditions: 90 days jail time, pay costs of action & costs of probation, complete any assessments as recommended by agent). Def waives right to prelim in 15CF66. Colloquy on waiver or prelim. Colloquy on plea questionnaire/waiver. NC plea entered for count 1 in 15CF66. Finding of guilty.  Comment by defendant. 

Sentencing: 

15CF66-Ct 1: withhold sentence for 3 yrs probation. Conditions: 90 days jail time, pay costs of action and costs of probation including DNA. Defendant is to pay restitution in amt of $500. Attend, pay for and successfully complete any treatment/assessments as ordered by agent. Def is eligible for expungement under 973.015 upon successful completion of probation. Def is to contact the Clerk of Court at that time. Court admonishes def. re. firearm prohibition and voting prohibition.  Parties stipulate to 9 days credit in the event of revocation.  

Ct 2: DRI

15CF84 & 15CF91-DRI
Status conference at 11-04-2015 03:30 pm

Defendant Dylan J. Moen in court with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  2 cases called together:  15CF84/initial and 15CF66/adj. initial.  Formal reading waived.  Charges stated.  Formal reading waived.  Possible penalties stated.  Status requested and set for 11/4 at 3:30.  Status conference scheduled for November 4, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

AMENDED - The curfew provision has been removed at this time.

Defendant is not to possess or consume alcohol.  Must submit to testing of blood, breath or urine on demand by law enforcement to monitor compliance. Defendant is not to enter into any bars/taverns or establishment where the sale of alcohol is the primary business. No contact with  JR.
